messages: 2094bee68ee0f6e601e94e85316257c4 (02:43): anyone can imagine why this line creates a crash
2094bee68ee0f6e601e94e85316257c4 (02:44): if i declare it in the function it works well
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (02:45): besides the fact that you probably could do this in a better way.. have you actually initialized the line edit?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (02:45): so far you just have a matrix of uninitialized pointers
2094bee68ee0f6e601e94e85316257c4 (02:46): yes i declare in a function
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (02:46): yes, but have you actually done anything like grid[i][j] = new QLineEdit
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (02:47): you know why you need to initialized pointers?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (02:47): why just "QLineEdit *edit" itself isn't valid?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (02:48): might as well assume as much
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (02:49): a pointer is just an address
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (02:50): if you have "int a" in a function do you expect it to have a certain value?
2094bee68ee0f6e601e94e85316257c4 (02:50): it has any value standing in the ram before
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (02:51): (as a side note, static variables should default to zero)
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (02:54): you have to allocate memory to use
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (02:55): if you have a pointer, you need to use "new" to allocate that memory or point it at something already allocated
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (02:58): try running it through a debugger
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (03:06): run it through gdb and when it crashes type "bt"
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (03:06): type "gdb your_program", then "run", then when it crashes "bt"
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (03:07): valgrind might also be useful
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (03:12): How and which channel do I IDENIFY my name?
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (03:20): When programming in Qt, is it necessary to have the class reference, or should I just memorize the classes?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (03:21): if you can remember them all, then go for it :-P
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (03:21): Blockd, have you remembered them or do you still find yourself going back to the references?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (03:23): there's no point in memorizing every little detail
e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (03:23): Blockd, I was just going along with your joke.
bc30efebc616c926326e4d84ce84fc0e (03:43): is there a way to pause a thread ?  i think it's possible using ptread, isn't it ?
bc30efebc616c926326e4d84ce84fc0e (03:43): anyway, i find nothing related in the QThread doc.. :/
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (03:47): void QThread::usleep ( unsigned long usecs )   [static protected]
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (03:52): i'm going to build a plugin-interface (multi-os) any good solutions? qplugin or qlibrary?
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (03:53): JtRip: why not use QPluginLoader?
bc30efebc616c926326e4d84ce84fc0e (03:54): JtRip:  some thread is doing some long computation that i want the user to be able to pause. so sleep*() wont do it.
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (03:54): if i build a plugin with new version of qt, then i can't load my plugin? how to avoid this? i read that qpluginloader doesn't support statil lib anymore
bc30efebc616c926326e4d84ce84fc0e (03:56): JtRip: i dont see how uslepp is different for that purpose. (that's why i wrote sleep* )
bc30efebc616c926326e4d84ce84fc0e (03:56): blockd: i see no easy way to do that with QWaitCondition.. (?)
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (03:57): wait until some condition is set...
bc30efebc616c926326e4d84ce84fc0e (03:58): blockd:  how do you see that . the main/gui thread set a condition on 'paused', and i should be able to make the computing thread to wait on this condition ?
bc30efebc616c926326e4d84ce84fc0e (03:58): but still, this is the other thread that wants to make the computing thread to pause.
bc30efebc616c926326e4d84ce84fc0e (04:01): what i actually want is one thread makes the other one to pause
caacdffd7a4aa3937fabe8e185e5165e (04:03): quit? then run it again (unpause ) :D
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (04:03): pthread_cond_wait... the "shared data" is something like "bool shouldRun"
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (04:03): it's really not that big a deal, but not totally straight-forward I guess
d29d567972e1e13b8bd390e5395b685d (04:06): but that's just QWaitCondition under the covers on unix
